hypothesis_content.title: ETH/BTC Ratio Breakout from 6-Month Range
hypothesis_content.statement: When the ETH/BTC ratio breaks above/below a 6-month consolidation range (defined by ±2.5% of the range midpoint) with daily RSI(14) confirming momentum (RSI >60 for bullish, <40 for bearish), the ratio will continue in the breakout direction for at least 4% over the next 10 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended consolidation in cross-currency pairs often resolves in sustained directional moves. RSI confirmation filters false breakouts. ETH tends to outperform BTC during risk-on periods within neutral/bull regimes.
entry_conditions: ETH/BTC ratio closes outside 6-month range (±2.5% of midpoint)
Daily RSI(14) >60 for bullish breakout OR <40 for bearish breakout
BTC regime is NEUTRAL or BULL (for ETH outperformance)
Breakout day volume in ETH spot markets >1.3x 20-day average

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Ratio closes back inside the 6-month range

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Ratio fails to sustain breakout and mean-reverts >70% of the time within 10 days.
